summary:
I love seeing character choice between campaigns that shed light on what the players are interested in or how they think
Like...
body:
I love seeing character choice between campaigns that shed light on what the players are interested in or how they think

Like you could write essays on marisha’s choices to explore feminine rage and sexist perceptions of frailty but I’m not gonna say that

What I am gonna say is that between the archdruid essentially endless shape change and beau’s potential for timeless body marisha wants to be fucking indestructible lol

Tbh fair

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!

blog.name: c-is-for-circinate
blog.title: Only happy when it's complicated...
blog.description:
I'm C, which stands for a wide variety of things, including but not limited to 'coiled in a spiral with the tip hidden at the center'.  Take that metaphor as you will.

I like liking things.  I also like writing things and knitting things.  Sometimes I write things about TV shows I wish I didn't like.  Sometimes I don't like much of anything in the whole universe, and we have a Bad Brains day around here and that is fine.  Sometimes I just reblog a lot of posts about yarn.

summary: ...so the Mighty Nein now appear to own a boat. There’s this quote I keep thinking of, as I watch this show.  It’s from an...
body:
…so the Mighty Nein now appear to own a boat.

There’s this quote I keep thinking of, as I watch this show.  It’s from an episode of Community–not one of the D&D episodes, although Abed’s got a line about creating a boundless universe and then binding it with rules that also resonates a bit.  It’s Jeff, looking with bemused victory at a sea of cardboard bears and birthday party hats:

I don’t know what we did, but we sure did the hell out of it.

I feel like this perfectly encapsulates the spirit of the Mighty Nein in general and also episode 35 in particular.  Like.  There were two men they intended to locate and have conversations with that day.  Two men.  A few words.  Possibly an intimidation check or two.  That was the day’s plan.  This morning they went and hung out at a lighthouse.

The fact that Mollymauk Tealeaf appears to have constituted a good 70% of this group’s impulse control should probably make the entire continent shiver in pants-wetting terror.

…and maybe the other continents, too, considering that they now appear to own a boat.

There’s this quote I keep thinking of, as I watch this show.  It’s from an episode of Community–not one of the D&D episodes, although Abed’s got a line about creating a boundless universe and then binding it with rules that also resonates a bit.  It’s Jeff, looking with bemused victory at a sea of cardboard bears and birthday party hats:

I don’t know what we did, but we sure did the hell out of it.

I feel like this perfectly encapsulates the spirit of the Mighty Nein in general and also episode 35 in particular.  Like.  There were two men they intended to locate and have conversations with that day.  Two men.  A few words.  Possibly an intimidation check or two.  That was the day’s plan.  This morning they went and hung out at a lighthouse.

The fact that Mollymauk Tealeaf appears to have constituted a good 70% of this group’s impulse control should probably make the entire continent shiver in pants-wetting terror.

summary: WONDERLAND HEARTS IS LOOKING FOR FJORD! Wonderland is only a place that you heard about in your dreams, in the stories. Yet here...
caption:
WONDERLAND HEARTS IS LOOKING FOR FJORD!

Wonderland is only a place that you heard about in your dreams, in the stories. Yet here you are, in a world that is mad beyond belief. The land is strange, and the world likes to play tricks on your eyes, mind, and heart. But there’s a reason that you were pulled from your own world and brought here.

Do you play along with the games of this new world? Or do you go about your own style? Will you stay hopelessly lost, continuously falling down the rabbit hole? Or will you join the madness that makes Wonderland?

Wonderland Hearts is a closed multi-fandom roleplay fating group where your character is taken from their original world. Here they keep their powers, but they’re strangely altered to keep things fun, to keep a game going. Together they’ll live with other strangers and begin their new life here: the one that the Cheshire Cat plots out for you.

…ready to fall down the rabbit hole?

Home. || Premise. || Rules. || Masterlist.

summary: I'm going to be honest: I am better drawing ladies than gentlemen. The right is the newest out of the two shown, and it looks...
body: I’m going to be honest: I am better drawing ladies than gentlemen. The right is the newest out of the two shown, and it looks like X-Men’s Gambit if X-Men was part of Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure, but TAKE IT. THE DESIGN IS DONE. I will finish Percy’s Pub Draw even if I will be a few episodes behind!
